title: Kaart der Zuyd-Wester Eylanden van Banda (Map of the South-wastern Banda Islands)

  physical_appearance: The map depicts the South-western region of the Banda islands. Different colours are used on the different islands
 ranging from pink to turquoise to yellow. The scale that is being utilized in this map is 1 : 15. There are no latitudes and longitudes on this map
 nor are there any black lines that extend out from the compass that is located on the upper right hand side of the map. On many of the islands
 there are pictorial representations of hills and mountains
 as well as trees.

  subject_terms_1: islands (landforms) colonial settlements

  subject_terms_2: Colonization depictions (visual works) Maps Islands East Indies Banda Islands (Indonesia) Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie

  sgcool_label_text: Francois Valentijn (1666–1727) was a minister
 naturalist and writer who served the Dutch V.O.C. in the East Indies in the late 17th and early 18th centuries. His monumental work Oud en Nieuw Oost-Indien (Old and New East-India)
 published between 1724 and 1726
 offers a comprehensive mapping of the East Indies with a large selection of scale maps and views. This map of the South-western Banda islands was published in that work.

metadata.title_text: Kaart der Zuyd-Wester Eylanden van Banda (Map of the South-wastern Banda Islands)
metadata.physical_appearance: The map depicts the South-western region of the Banda islands. Different colours are used on the different islands, ranging from pink to turquoise to yellow. The scale that is being utilized in this map is 1 : 15. There are no latitudes and longitudes on this map, nor are there any black lines that extend out from the compass that is located on the upper right hand side of the map. On many of the islands, there are pictorial representations of hills and mountains, as well as trees.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Colonization depictions (visual works) Maps Islands East Indies Banda Islands (Indonesia) Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Francois Valentijn (1666–1727) was a minister, naturalist and writer who served the Dutch V.O.C. in the East Indies in the late 17th and early 18th centuries. His monumental work Oud en Nieuw Oost-Indien (Old and New East-India), published between 1724 and 1726, offers a comprehensive mapping of the East Indies with a large selection of scale maps and views. This map of the South-western Banda islands was published in that work.
